page.title: 20A day in Pontefract.
page.content: This day in the life of Pontefract is a market day,where food and a variety of items are bought and sold.It is a busy town with people bustling everywhere.In the middle of the market place there is a Buttercross which Elizabeth Dupier had built in memory of her husband in 1734.There has been a market in Pontefract for many hundreds of years it was made better by making market place a pedestrian precinct in 1980. The names of the streets near the market Beastfair,Cornmarket, Shoemarket,and Ropergate tell us what was sold or what was made there.Northgate and Southgate were entrances to the Castle.Our colourful stretches to the Town Hall and St.Giles Church which has been the Parish Church since 1789. by Joanne Stewardson.
